content:
Here are some authentic eateries and food stalls in Macao that locals frequent:

1. Mak Mak: This local eatery located on the Cotai Strip is well known for its Portuguese style chicken and pork chop buns. 2. Loja Sopa de Fita Cheong Kei 8: This noodle soup stall is a local favourite for their Macanese-style noodle soup with shredded pork, vegetables and wontons. 3. Tai Lei Loi Kei: This old-time classic restaurant is famous for their pork chop buns and is a top choice for locals when they are looking for a quick, satisfying meal. 4. CAF: The local café is a cafe chain that is well known for their traditional egg tarts, almond cookies and milk tea. 5. San Ma Lo St: This bustling street is home to many food stores, including some of the best-selling places to try out local street food like fish ball soup, curry crab cakes and peanut candy. 6. Riquexo: This family-run restaurant on Rua do Campo is known for its famous African Chicken and other Macanese delicacies. 7. Tsui Heng Village Restaurant: This is a popular spot for breakfast and serves traditional Chinese dim sum like steamed shrimp dumplings, roasted pork buns and egg tarts. I hope you enjoy trying out these local eateries and discovering the flavors of Macao!
